duck: Quantum Xrroid Consciousness Interface is a bioresonance machine that was invented by former NASA Engineer Dr.
Quantum Xrroid Consciousness Interface is a bioresonance machine that was invented by former NASA Engineer Dr.

wiki.text:
'Electro Physiological Feedback Xrroid' ('EPFX'), also known as 'Quantum Xrroid
Consciousness Interface' ('QXCI'), is a discredited "energy medicine" device
which claims to read the body’s reactivity to various frequencies and then send
back other frequencies to make changes in the body.<ref name="st-1"/><ref name=-
"CBC">[http://www.cbc.ca/marketplace/2009/miracle_makers_or_money_takers/main.h-
tml Miracle makers or money takers?], CBC News Marketplace, Feb 27, 2009</ref>
It is manufactured and marketed by self-styled "Professor Bill Nelson" also
known as Desiré Dubounet.<ref name="CBC" /> Nelson is currently operating in
Hungary, a fugitive from the US following indictment on fraud charges connected
to EPFX.<ref name="st-1"></ref>

Descriptions of the device in mainstream media note its high price tag ($20,000
US) and the improbable nature of the claims made for it.<ref
name="BadScience"></ref> It has reportedly been used to "treat" a variety of
serious diseases including cancer. In one documented case, undiagnosed and
untreated leukaemia resulted in the death of a patient.<ref name="st-2"></ref>

The website Quackwatch posted an analysis of the device by Stephen Barrett which
concludes: "The Quantum Xrroid device is claimed to balance 'bio-energetic'
forces that the scientific community does not recognize as real. It mainly
reflects skin resistance (how easily low-voltage electric currents from the
device pass through the skin), which is not related to the body's
health."<ref></ref>

Imports to the US are now banned.<ref>[http://www.newsinferno.com/archives/11605
FDA Takes Action Against Fake Medical Device], NewsInferno.com, 10 August
2009</ref>
wiki.title: Electro%20Physiological%20Feedback%20Xrroid
